command.label: Command to trigger script
command.tooltip: The command that has to be written before the calculation.

max_precision.label: Maximum precision
max_precision.tooltip: Precision after the decimal separator with which to round. Also specifies after how many digits scientific notation is triggered. NOTE: If set to more than 15, float rounding issues may occur frequently

timeout.label: Delay between calls in seconds
timeout.tooltip: Limits how often the command can be called.

max_string_len.label: Maximal length of result if it is a string
max_string_len.tooltip: Limit the length of a string result.

^-behaviour.label: Behavious of ^ operator
^-behaviour.tooltip: Specify how x^y is to be interpreted. Python default is Bitwise XOR, so 2^4=6, though in common writing the ^ denotes power (2^4=16). When set to Nothing, bot displays a hint for clarification.
